But the cauliflower was not grilled as promised, I was waiting for crunch but never received any. The kimchi slider was ok. The chicken quesadilla was good but lacked the expected chipotle flavor. I did like the tortilla that was used, had an almost buttery flavor. I didn't like the pickled cabbage in the shrimp taco though the shrimp was good. 

I think the most disappointing item was the Chana masala taco. I took one bite and couldn't go further. I guess I am biased, I have had a lot of Chana masala as that is one of my favorite Indian dishes. But I do know coconut milk has no business with Chana masala. The traditional Chana masala dish is made with a tomato base, no creamy aspect at all. Nor does it involve an American mirepoix with celery or carrots. I did not like this item at all, bleh! 

I don't think I will be returning, this was the first time triple D let me down.

Wow! What can I say... I really really enjoyed my tacos. Apparently The Tin Kitchen comes to our corporate campus every Friday -- WHO KNEW??? NOT I! And damn happy that I do now. 

Let me tell you this, for a fusion taco truck to come rolling up out of the blue in corporate center hell, it made me pinch myself. And then to be slapped across the face by those smells that came from the truck--man was I in awe. 

I usually brown bag it as the food they serve here is not worth the money... bland as hell, but now I know when and where I will be shelling out some dough -- Friday's baby, that's when and it going to be go to the Tin Kitchen! 

These guys are super nice and accommodating! I left with my food in hand and a smile knowing they really care about their product and customer service. 

I had the "Smoked Salmon Tacos-Flash seared smoked salmon, cilantro-japanese rice, pineapple pico de gallo, & cilantro lime aioli" 

At first, when I was reading the menu, I thought to myself there were to many flavors going on... but I was sold on smoked salmon and said what the hell! 

Let me tell you.. I was completely wrong.. the layering of these flavors hit a home run. From the homemade tortillas, to the pico de gallo (they actually know what that is and how it should be prepared)  I was truly in heaven. Now don't expect anything to be Mexican because they use the word 'taco" -- that is just the vessel of how it is going to get into your mouth.. this is completely fusion. A fresh look at an old favorite. 

Tomorrow is Friday and you can bet on where I will be come noon... getting me some Tin Kitchen on!

I love a good food truck, but TIN Kitchen has set the bar so much higher than any other food truck I've had!

They offer tacos, quesadillas, salads and nachos etc. and even have combo plates available (3 tacos for $10!) if you want to get a bang for your buck. 

The food is awesome, we ordered the following:

*3 Taco Combo with Pork Belly, Brisket and Shrimp
*Chicken Quesadilla Combo with Rice and Beans
*Nachos (we did not add meat--though it is an option for $3 more)

Everything was so tasty. The pork belly was my personal favorite, but all the tacos were fresh and flavorful. Each had it's own sauce that truly enhanced the taste of the proteins. The nachos also stood out as they are so different from what you expect. They are served with cotija cheese, salsa verda and a pretty hot red sauce. The chips are cold--which I know sounds strange, but the flavor profile with all the ingredients really works. 

Great experience all around!

Food Truck Friday - YUMMM!! Order everything!!

*Best tip: The Spicy Pickled Veggies are truly spicy, not at first, but a huge bite to em at the end.

Ate here for the first time today and it was great! I ordered two tacos, one chala masala and the other chicken taza, both amazing! I can't wait to bring my husband when he comes home and other friends and family! I know they frequently park in front of Noda brewing co. so that will be fun! Can't wait to see the triple D episode! Highly recommended for someone who loves lots of flavor combinations! :)

So it's been a year and I decided to give Tin Kitchen another try when I saw them recently at Triple C Brewery.

There were several new taco options on their menu and this time I opted for the Oaxacan Chicken Mole tacos.  The chicken was very tender and was topped with an amazing herb salad on grilled tortillas.  The tortillas were great and not rubbery this time around.  I just wish this option had a bit of heat to it.  

I also opted for the Caldo Verde soup which was great with lots of kale, white beans and bits of chorizo.   My side item was the Peruvian 3-bean salad.  The flavors in the salad were great but I thought one of the beans was a bit too raw yet and could have been cooked longer.

Since it was raining outside, I appreciated that one of the guys came inside to take orders. 

Overall, I think the food was much better this time than my previous times visiting this truck.
Just had falafel, quesadilla and another item...with chickpeas and couscous. All we're excellent!  Service and presentation was also great. Would definitely recommend.
